Fragment containing letter of confraternity for the Trinitarian Order for ransom of captives--Cf. STC (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in the Lambeth Palace Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p:
✚FRater Iohānes Brocden de Telliſforde wygornien̄ dioc. ſancte Trinitaris et redemptionis captiuorum certe ſanct / qui ſunt incarcerati pro fide Ieſu Chriſtis paganis. Dilect
er nobis in Chriſto _____ Salutem in dfio ſempiternā. Notū facimꝰ ꝙ
quam plurimi romani pontifices oc̄s et ſingulos cōfratres et ſorores nōi p
er dicti ordinis multis priuilegiis dotauerint preſertim in co ꝙ. Clemens .v. oībus vere penitentibus et cōfeſſis vel infra annō cōfiteri volentibus poſt declarationē ſuarū indulgentiatū ꝓ ſuis indulgentus acq̄rendis in feſtiuitatibꝰ dn̄i nōi Ieſu Chriſti / vem natiuitatis / circūciſionis / apparitionis / reſurrectiōis / aſcētionis / pētecoſtes; ſancte trinitatis et euchariſtie / et in quatuor feſtiuitatibus beate virginis Marie ꝑ ſingulos dies dictatū feſtiuitatū .vij. annos et. vij. quadragenas eiſdem benefactoribus de min̄ eiis ſibi penitentūs relaxauit. et per oēs oct
er dictorū feſtiuitatū .iii. ānos et .iii. quadragenas. Itē ꝑ totū quadrageſimam ſingulis diebꝰ .i. anno et .xl. dies. ¶Innocētius .iiii. vnū annū. et .xl. dies indulgentie cōceſſi et ſeptimā ꝑtē penitentie relaxauit. Nec non dīs peccata venialis et oblita offenſas patrum & matrū ſine manuū iniectione / ac oīa votū fracto. excepto voto hieroſolymienuo / caſtitatis / et religionis / diſpenſando tamen et attribuendo cōuenienter dictio tribus ſecundū qualitatē voto
rum . et quantitatem perſone tranſgreſſiones fidei notamenta falſa / ſerviones ocioſos / vanas cogitationes / oīa feſta ſanctor male celebrata. et de gratia ſpeciali diē ſetm̄ dn̄icum male celebratum. Vſuras / rapinas & omnia bona male acquiſita: niſi ſciant cui talia reddenda ſint ſimiliter in dn̄o relaxauit. ¶Item in ꝑticipationem ſancte mt̄is eccleſie et peregrinationem ferre ſācte omnes benefactores participes. nec nō et omnes parentes viuos et mortuos cōſortes fecit ineternum. ¶Clemens .vi. oībus vere penitentibꝰ & cōfeſſis et volentibus cōfiteri qui ad ſuſtentationem dicti ordinis manꝰ portererint adiutrices toties quoties ſuas dederint elemoſinas tertiā ꝑtem penitentie criminū cōfeſſorū et ſuā benedictionem in ſecula ſeculorū cōceſſit. tres inſup annos. et .xl. dies de iniuncta penitentia relaxauit. Etiā cōceſſit ꝙ omnes cōfratres et cōſorores poſuit ſibi annuatim eligere idoneū preſbyterū in cōfeſſorem: qui eis cōcedere valeat plenariā abſolutionem peccatorū ſuorū de quibꝰ ſūt vere cōtriti & cōfeſſi. Et ꝙ omnibꝰ cōfratribus et cōſororibꝰ habentibꝰ ſcriptū dicte fraternitatis ſepultura eccleſiaſtica nō negetur quacū
que morte moriatur tā in tempore interdicti
quam aliis niſi noīatim fuerint excōicati. Preſbyteris et clericis et aliis ſacerdotibus ſecularibus ac viris religioſis tā vitis
quam mulieribꝰ cuiuſcun
que religionis et habitus. ſi dicto ordini de bonis ſuis tranſmiſerint quicquid per impotentiā / negligentiam / obliuionem aut corporis debilitatem in diuinis officiis et horis canonicis homiſerint penitus eſt eis remiſſum. ¶Item ſi quis benefactor infra ānum moriatur de oībus petis ſuis vere cōtritꝰ et cōfeſſus eſt de gratia ſpeciali abſolutus. ¶Bonifacius .viii. Clemens / v. Benedictus .vi. Honoriꝰ. .iii. Vrbanꝰ .v. quilibet eorū cōceſſit vnū ānum et centum dies. ¶Alerander .iiii. cōceſſit .iii. annos. et .xl. dies indulgentie et relaxauit ſeptimā ꝑtem penitentie. Et ſtatuit his q̇ in dictā frat
er nitatem aſſumentur ſi eccleſie ad quas ꝑtinerent forent int
er dicte ipſoſ
que mori cōtigerit niſi excōicati noīatim vel interdicti forent ſepultura eccleſiaſtica non negetur. ¶Pius .ii. cōceſſit cōfratribus dicte confraternitatis facultatem eligendi ydoneum cōfeſſorem qui eos annuatim in omnibꝰ caſibꝰ ſedi apoſtolice nō reſeruatis et ſemel in vita in oībus caſibꝰ ſedi apoſtolice quomodo libet reſeruat poſſit abſoluere et .iii. annos ac .xl. dies de iniūctis eis penitentiis ī dn̄o relaxauit. ¶Innocentiꝰ .viii. cōceſſit vt q̇libet fratrū in̄ receptorū vel q̇ impoſterū recipient poſſit eligere ydoneū preſbyterū ſecularem vel cuiuſuis ordinis etiā mendicantium in ſuum confeſſorem / qui eius cōfeſſione diligenter audita / in mortis articulo oīm ſuorum peccatorū indulgentiam et remiſſionem impendat. Clemens .vi. cōceſſit ꝙ ſi quis ab ingreſſu eccleſie fuerit ſuſpenſus / vel aliquam penitentiā circa eccleſiā facturus illa die qua dicti fratres procuratores vel eorū nuncū ad aliquas eccleſias peruenerint in honore ſācte Trinitatis illa die relaxabitur. ¶Item voluit et cōceſſit ꝙ ſi quis clericus vel laicus hoc impedierit actu / verbo / vel opere dyabolo inſtigāte / quod nō credit / ſciat ſe excōicatum et anathematizarū eſſe. et beneficiū ſue abſolutiōis obtineri. quouſ
que de dāno dicti ordinis cōtemptu
que romane eccleſie ſatiſfecerit competenter. ¶Nouiſſime vero ſanctiſſimus in xp̄o pater et dominus dn̄s Clemens papa .vii. modernus oīa p
er dicta priuilegia et ſua gt̄a ſpeciali cōfirmauit et ratificauit. ¶Nos igitur miniſter et ft̄es antedicti eiuſdē loci de noſtra ſpeciali gratia in oībus miſſis orationibus / reiunūs / vigiliis / abſtinentiis / elemoſinis / ceteriſ
que bonis et ſuffragiis in dicto noſtro ordini factis et faciendis eiſdem in dn̄o participamus. Preterea poſt corūdem deceſſum et ſuarū litterarū exhibitionem in nt̄o cōuentuali capitulo eadem ꝓ illis fiet commendatio q̄ pro nobis fieri cōſueuit. Et per preſent̄ in noſtrā ſactā cōfraternitatem vos deuote recipimus.

closer.dateline: Dat̄ ſub ſigillo noſtre cōfraternitatis predicte. Anno dn̄i. M. D. xxix.

div.head: ¶Annualis abſolutio.
div.p: ¶Dn̄s noſter Ieſus chriſtus ꝑ ſuam piiſſimā miſericordiā abſoluat te. Et ego authoritate litteratū apoſtolicatū abſoluote dando tibi plenariā abſolutionē oīm peccatorū tuorū et etiā abſoluo te ab oībꝰ caſibus ſedi apoſtolice nō reſeruatis. In nole pr̄is. &c.

div.head: ¶Abſolutio ſemel in vita.
div.p: ¶Dn̄s noſter Ieſus chriſtus. &c. Etiam abſoluo te ab oībus peccatis tuis etiam caſibus ſedi apoſtolice quomodolibet reſeruatio. In nomine patris. &c.

div.head: ¶Plenaria remiſſio in mortis articulo.
div.p:
¶Dn̄s noſter. &c. Dando tibi plenariā oīm peccatorū tuorū indulgentiā & remiſſionem in quantū claues ſancte matris eccleſie ſe extendunt et ſis abſolutus aut▪ tribunal dn̄i nt̄i Ieſu chriſti habeaſ
que vitam eternam et viuas in ſecula ſeculorum. Amen.
